title: The Image of empire: the early Roman Empire and the rise of christianity
creator_credit: Mary Hoskins, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
brief_description: How, in the absence of modern means of communication can a Roman Emperor project an image of himself and his rule? J. Ferguson discusses the various forms of imperial propaganda which included patriotic writing, the use of inscriptions, coinage, sculpture and public works.
